events.title: Abnormal Serum Vitamin B12 and Folate Levels
events.description: The patient exhibited abnormal serum vitamin B12 and folate levels, with a serum vitamin B12 level of < 148 ng/L (normal range: 200 - 900 ng/L) and a serum folate level of < 2.2 ng/ml (normal range: 3 - 20.5 ng/ml). This indicates a deficiency that may require further evaluation and management.

events.title: Full Blood Count Results
events.description: The full blood count revealed a haemoglobin concentration of 113 g/L, which is below the normal range of 115 - 165 g/L, indicating potential anemia. Additionally, the red blood cell distribution width was noted at 16.7%, exceeding the normal range of 11 - 15%, suggesting possible underlying hematological issues.

events.title: Elevated Serum Potassium Level
events.description: The serum potassium level was recorded at 5.9 mmol/L, which is above the normal range of 3.5 - 5.3 mmol/L. This hyperkalemia may pose risks for cardiac complications and requires monitoring and potential intervention.

events.title: Body Mass Index and Weight Concerns
events.description: The patient's body mass index (BMI) was calculated at 15.77 Kg/m², indicating underweight status, and the weight was recorded at 35 Kg (≈ 5 st 7 lb). This low BMI may suggest malnutrition or other health issues that need to be addressed.

events.title: Elevated Blood Pressure Readings
events.description: Blood pressure readings were noted at 138/111 mmHg, indicating hypertension. This condition may require lifestyle modifications and/or pharmacological intervention to manage cardiovascular risk.
